extent.charseq: GEORGE WASHINGTON LAW SCHOOL DEAN TO TAKE HELM AT BRANDEIS

Brandeis, which was established in 1948 and is the nation's youngest major research university, made great gains during Reinharz's tenure - admitting higher-caliber students, tripling the college's endowment, and establishing new academic programs.
the nation's youngest major research university, made great gains during Reinharz's tenure - admitting higher-caliber students
Civil rights scholar Frederick M. Lawrence
Lawrence, who taught law at Boston University Law School for 17 years before moving to Washington in 2005
a student on the search committee
a scholar of distinction who knows what it is like to run a place, but the most important thing is he knows that everything that happens in a university or a law school is also a teaching moment
the dean of George Washington University Law School
former dean of Yale Law School
the national legal affairs committee of the Anti-Defamation League,
a nonsectarian school with deep roots in the Jewish community
Boston University Law School for 17 years before moving to Washington in 2005
But the school faced major financial pressures after the economy - and the university's once $712 million endowment - plummeted and donations slowed to a trickle.

In February, the university - which enrolls 3,200 undergraduates - also developed a plan to create a balanced operating budget by 2014 that involved cutting two dozen faculty positions and eliminating a range of academic offerings, including the Hebrew undergraduate major.
a liberal arts college that is an anchor for a great university
an anchor for a great university
his native state of New York
an assistant US attorney for his native state of New York
the office's civil rights division under then-US attorney Rudy Giuliani
Search committee members also commended Lawrence's inclusive leadership style
three Indian universities, including cofounding a law school in Kharagpur with the India Institute of Technology
a US Circuit Court of Appeals judge who, as former dean of Yale Law School, taught Lawrence in the late 1970s and remains a friend and mentor
an Ohio State law professor to discuss his book on word taboos
speakers or artwork critical of Israel
